Bitcoin transactions do not require any personal data to be submitted, protecting you from identity theft. And there can be no chargebacks - once sent, Bitcoins transactions are unchangeable. This ways the transaction cannot be reversed or reverted from the way it was recorded in Bitcoin's public ledger, which makes for fewer risks for people who sells.It is private: Since no personal information is tying to your Bitcoin wallet, people do not know who (bought something for money) what. If you are planning to gamble in Bitcoin, make sure you know what your local tax law says on your winnings or from betting with crypto.
